comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment:
All these tests are testing both the LeaveRequest .getSortedAbsencePeriods() logic as well as the OCCaseForAbsenceDAO.getLatestApprovedLeaveRequestEndDate() logic.
i.e. you are retesting what is already tested in LeaveRequestTest tests getSortedAbsencePeriods_Ascending getSortedAbsencePeriods_Descending
I would have thought we would be mocking the result of getApprovedLeaveRequests and getSortedAbsencePeriods, and just testing the looping and date compare logic here?

reviewTimeLines.summary: FAB-5372:Enable Time Trigger Daemon in Absence

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: What does this do? JIRA has no description. I dont understand what this is for....

comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment: Time triggers can be configured on a step in the process. The time trigger is a rule which returns a date. Once that date is reached the process is pushed on automatically. This is to enable time triggers in Absence via the use of the TimeTriggerDaemon which pings for the date & knows whether to push the process on or not

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Could we add the above info as a comment on the XML config, just to shrae the knowledge

comments.author: Jose Martinez
comments.comment: INFO? Not sure about that in production envs.

comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment: INFO is the default for this on FDP & B & P. Think we always ship with INFO as the default & if needed on site then changes to ERROR. You still want me to change this?

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Seems method has been removed in that review

comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment: Should these be set to the defaults, _Please Select_ & _Unknown_? I know if I was creatuing a new builder I wouldn't expect these to be set, I'd _personall_ expect to have to explicity set them

comments.author: Brian Cowzer
comments.comment: the pattern seems to be to supply values other than default and use the methods is you want to set to something specific. see AbsenceEmployerBuilder for an example.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Initially, I was of the opinion we should set things to something other than the default. However, i'm not so sure anymore. The idea of the builders is that you can use the basic object without needing to change stuff you dont care about. For example, AbsenceReasonBuilder, we would always populate the mandatory things like name, qualiifer1 and qualifier2, absence reason coverage etc. For enums that are not mandatory, I'm coming around to the opinion just to set as PLEASE_SELECT in the builder, and allow the tests to set them if needed. The main idea of the builder is that mandatory things are populated to something sensible. Not sure if that helps!

comments.author: Brian Cowzer
comments.comment: Kinda, Trevor!! I can see both of you are leaning towards please select/unknown in this case, so have made the change.

comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment: Do we need an @Widget here?

reviewTimeLines.summary: FAB-4743: Query for retrieving Allowed Days for Known Absence Periods by SelectedLeavePlan

comments.author: Daniel Delgado
comments.comment: Tests and/or integration tests for this?

comments.author: Daniel Delgado
comments.comment: Add them to the before method or create constants.

comments.author: Daniel Delgado
comments.comment: I know this method is based on a parameter but I prefer to create a @Before method with all the data.

comments.author: Daniel Dardis
comments.comment: IMO creating all the data for all tests in @Before is not a good approach, we should have in the @Before what is common for all tests and every test is allowed to create additional data for itself, considering the @Before is call for every test if we try to create all data for all tests for every test executation sounds not efficient. I'll drop this.

comments.author: Daniel Delgado
comments.comment: Maybe two sets of data help you to not create a double commit per test.

comments.author: Daniel Dardis
comments.comment: double commit removed

comments.author: Daniel Delgado
comments.comment: No tests updates after all these changes?

comments.author: Daniel Dardis
comments.comment: Good point, even though sounds like huge change that was the easiest way to solve an issue with the joins, anyway I added two more tests to cover that.
